parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To look away from (something else) to, see distinctly. From apo and horao; to consider attentively.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Originator, author, founder, prince, leader. From arche and ago; a chief leader.
And, even, also, namely.
A perfecter, completer, finisher. From teleioo; a completer, i.e. Consummater.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Who, which, what, that.
A primary particle; opposite, i.e. Instead or because of.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Joy, gladness, a source of joy. From chairo; cheerfulness, i.e. Calm delight.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Genitive Feminine Singular
str2: From pro and keimai; to lie before the view, i.e. to be present, to stand forth.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From hupo and meno; to stay under, i.e. Remain; figuratively, to undergo, i.e. Bear, have fortitude, persevere.
A cross.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To despise, scorn, and show it by active insult, disregard. From kata and phroneo; to think against, i.e. Disesteem.
Shame, shamefacedness, shameful deeds. From aischunomai; shame or disgrace.
And, both. A primary particle of connection or addition; both or also.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Another form for kathezomai; to seat down, i.e. Set; intransitively, to sit; figuratively, to settle.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
On the right hand, right hand, right. From dechomai; the right side or hand.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From thrao; a stately seat; by implication, power or a potentate.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
